abstract.text: Discover and invite other players to participate in a real-time game.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

metadata.title: Finding multiple players for a game

inlineContent.text: GameKit enables the user of your game, called the
local player
, to discover and connect with other players in real-time multiplayer games.
For design guidance, see

content.text: Choose whether to use the Game Center interface

inlineContent.text: You can present a Game Center interface that allows the local player to invite nearby or recent players, friends, contacts, Game Center or Message groups, and anyone with a phone number or email address.

The default interface allows the player to use automatic matches to fill any empty slots. The local player can see the status of players accepting or declining their invitations, as they invite additional players or remove players. Once the number of players that you specify accept their invitations, the local player can start gameplay. Optionally, your game can continue processing responses to invitations, and GameKit can continue automatching to fill empty slots until the maximum number of players that you specify join the game.
Alternatively, you can present your own custom interface to invite players, invite specific players, or let Game Center automatch players without presenting an interface.

In your code, you create a match request and optionally present the matchmaker view controller. Then you implement methods to present the appropriate interface to all players during the process of receiving and accepting invitations.
First, create a
object and set the parameters of the game. You can set the number of players, apply groups and attributes to filter the matches, specify the game mode, and set other criteria.

content.text: Accept an invitation from another player

inlineContent.text: Game Center sends invitations to the players asynchronously. When a player accepts an invitation from another player, GameKit notifies Game Center and invokes the
method.
Implement the

method to present the matchmaker view controller in the invitation state so the recipient of the invitation can see the progress as other players accept their invitations. Create the matchmaker view controller by passing the invite to the initializer, and then present it.

content.text: Start the game when players accept invitations

inlineContent.text: The matchmaker view controller shows the players who received or accepted invitations. When all the players accept their invitations, GameKit invokes the
method in the app instances for all players in the game, including the player who sent the invitations.
Implement the

method to dismiss the view controller and start your game. If the player count is low or players accept invitations quickly, you can add a delay before you dismiss the view controller, so players see the outgoing invitations before you start the game.

code: // Start the game with the players in the match.

delegate method to dismiss the view controller.

content.text: Let Game Center match the player with others

inlineContent.text: GameKit can automatch the local player without presenting the Game Center matchmaking interface where players invite others. To start automatch, pass the match request to the shared

abstract.text: Integrate hardware sensing features to produce augmented reality apps and games.
Create a more customized and optimized gaming experience by using matchmaking rules to find players in a real-time game.
Presents a view controller modally.
A true value.
Enable players to interact with friends, compare leaderboard ranks, earn achievements, and participate in multiplayer games.
The error structure used by this framework.
An invitation to join a match sent to the local player from another player.
A protocol that handles invite events from Game Center.
Handles the event when the local player accepts an invitation from another player.
A protocol that handles events for Game Center players.
A peer-to-peer network between a group of players that sign into Game Center.
Handles when players connect or disconnect from a match.
An object that encapsulates the parameters to create a real-time or turn-based match.
The maximum number of players that can join the match.
Returns the maximum number of players allowed in the match request for a given match type.
The minimum number of players that can join the match.
The criteria for the local player that Game Center uses to find other players when using matchmaking rules.
The name of the queue that Game Center places the match request in.
The players to invite to the match.
A match hosted on your private server.
A peer-to-peer match hosted by Game Center.
A turn-based match hosted by Game Center.
An object that creates matches with other players without presenting an interface to the players.
Initiates a request to find players for a peer-to-peer match.
Informs the server when programmatic matchmaking finishes.
Begins a SharePlay activity for your game when a FaceTime call is active.
An interface that allows a player to invite other players to a real-time game and automatch to fill any empty slots.
A Boolean value that indicates whether your game can start after a minimum number of players join a match.
The mode that a multiplayer game uses to find players.
An object that handles when the status of matchmaking changes.
Handles when a view controller encounters an error while finding players for a match.
Handles when the view controller finds players for a peer-to-peer match.
Handles when a player cancels a request to find players for a match.
A mode that matches the local player only with players who are also actively looking for a match.
A mode that matches the local player only with players who they invite, and doesn’t use automatch to fill empty slots.
A mode that matches the local player only with nearby players.
A state in which a player connects to the match and can receive data.
Enable players to voice chat with all, or groups of, players in a multiplayer game.

abstract.text: Develop games where multiple players interact in real time.
Send data between players in a real-time multiplayer game.

doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/Ga.title: Exchanging data between players in real-time games

abstract.text: Game Center applies different type of rules you create in a particular order to find the best matches.
